text.p: Argentina is thinking of launching a 30-year overseas bond issue, said local media Wednesday.
El Cronista newspaper said the Economy Ministry is considering selling $1.0 billion of the new 30-year bond.

"This is the first time Argentina would be voluntarily placing a 30-year bond and it would be the first time a Latin American country launched such a bond," Miguel Angel Kiguel, Under-Secretary of Financing, told El Cronista.
Argentina has long-term bonds but they all come under its Brady program.

The launch of the issue will depend on whether Congress agrees to raise the debt ceiling for the year. Argentina has issued $7.140 billion so far in 1996 and the government has asked Congress to approve another $4.0 billion.
